sentence.Network_en: His government did not receive full recognition by Britain until July.

sentence.Network_en: The situation in Eastern Europe has changed out of all recognition.
sentence.Network_cn: 东欧的形势经历了巨变。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting the acknowledgement of a service): from Latin recognitio(n-), from the verb recognoscere 'know again, recall to mind' (see recognize)

entry.def: Recognition is the act of recognizing someone or identifying something when you see it.

example.ex: George said, 'Ida, how are you?' She frowned for a moment and then recognition dawned. 'George Black. Well, I never.'...
example.tran: 乔治说：“艾达，你好吗？”她皱了一会儿眉头，然后才认出他。“乔治·布莱克，噢，我一直都不好。”

example.ex: He searched for a sign of recognition on her face, but there was none.
example.tran: 他试图在她的脸上找出一丝认出他的神情，但是根本没有。

entry.def: Recognition of something is an understanding and acceptance of it.

example.ex: The CBI welcomed the Chancellor's recognition of the recession and hoped for a reduction in interest rates.
example.tran: 英国工业联合会对财政大臣承认经济出现衰退表示欢迎，并希望能出台降低利率的政策。

entry.tran: （政府对他国的）外交认可，正式承认
entry.def: When a government gives diplomatic recognition to another country, they officially accept that its status is valid.

example.ex: South Africa gave diplomatic recognition to Rwanda's new government on September 15...
example.tran: 南非于9月15日正式承认了卢旺达的新政府。

example.ex: His government did not receive full recognition by Britain until July.
example.tran: 他的政府直到7月份才得到英国的正式承认。

entry.def: When a person receives recognition for the things that they have done, people acknowledge the value or skill of their work.

example.ex: At last, her father's work has received popular recognition...
example.tran: 最后，她父亲的工作得到了大众的认可。

example.ex: He is an outstanding goalscorer who doesn't get the recognition he deserves.
example.tran: 他是一个出色的射手，但并没有获得应有的认可。

entry.tran: 面目全非;认不出来;无法辨认
entry.def: If you say that someone or something has changed beyond recognition or out of all recognition, you mean that person or thing has changed so much that you can no longer recognize them.

example.ex: The bodies were mutilated beyond recognition...
example.tran: 尸体都残缺不全，无法辨认了。

example.ex: The facilities have improved beyond all recognition...
example.tran: 这些设备经过大幅度的改良，都让人认不出来了。

entry.def: If something is done in recognition of someone's achievements, it is done as a way of showing official appreciation of them.

example.ex: Brazil normalised its diplomatic relations with South Africa in recognition of the steps taken to end apartheid...
example.tran: 巴西恢复了与南非的外交关系，以示对其采取措施结束种族隔离的正式认可。

example.ex: He had just received a doctorate in recognition of his contributions to seismology.
example.tran: 他刚被授予了博士头衔以表彰他对地震学作出的贡献。

means.word_mean: 1. the state or quality of being recognized or acknowledged;

sentences.sentence: "the partners were delighted with the recognition of their work"
"she seems to avoid much in the way of recognition or acknowledgement of feminist work prior to her own"

means.word_mean: 2. the process of recognizing something or someone by remembering;

sentences.sentence: "a politician whose recall of names was as remarkable as his recognition of faces"
"experimental psychologists measure the elapsed time from the onset of the stimulus to its recognition by the observer"
"he was given credit for his work"
"the credits were given at the end of the film"

means.word_mean: 4. coming to understand something clearly and distinctly;

sentences.sentence: "a growing realization of the risk involved"
"a sudden recognition of the problem he faced"
"increasing recognition that diabetes frequently coexists with other chronic diseases"

means.word_mean: 5. (biology) the ability of one molecule to attach to another molecule that has a complementary shape;

sentences.sentence: "molecular recognition drives all of biology, for instance, hormone and receptor or antibody-antigen interactions or the organization of molecules into larger biologically active entities"

means.word_mean: 6. the explicit and formal acknowledgement of a government or of the national independence of a country;

sentences.sentence: "territorial disputes were resolved in Guatemala's recognition of Belize in 1991"

means.word_mean: 7. an acceptance (as of a claim) as true and valid;

sentences.sentence: "the recognition of the Rio Grande as a boundary between Mexico and the United States"

means.word_mean: 8. designation by the chair granting a person the right to speak in a deliberative body;

sentences.sentence: "he was unable to make his motion because he couldn't get recognition by the chairman"

auth_sentence.res_content: Boyle received the Flavelle Medal...in recognition of his researches.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Boyle received the Flavelle Medal...in recognition of his researches.

auth_sentence.content: Tim's momentary glance did not even show recognition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tim's momentary glance did not even show recognition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tim's momentary glance did not even show recognition.

auth_sentence.content: Most significantly, forecasting has improved beyond all recognition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most significantly, forecasting has improved beyond all recognition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most significantly, forecasting has improved beyond all recognition.

Publicise their research to win international recognition.

means.word_mean: 认识; 认出; 识别; 承认; 认可

sentences.en: She hoped she would avoid recognition by wearing dark glasses and a hat.
sentences.cn: 她戴上墨镜和帽子, 希望人们认不出她来。

sentences.en: Their recognition of the new law is unlikely.
sentences.cn: 这项新法律不大可能获得他们的承认。

jushi.english: Their recognition of the new law is unlikely.
jushi.chinese: 这项新法律不大可能获得他们的承认。

jushi.english: She hoped she would avoid recognition by wearing dark glasses and a hat.
jushi.chinese: 她戴上墨镜和帽子,希望人们认不出她来。

jushi.english: He was presented with a check in recognition of his forty years' services to the company.
jushi.chinese: 公司赠送他一张支票,酬谢他为公司服务40年。
